page.title: 08ARABLE FARMING IN GROVE.
page.content: Low Farm in Grove has been in the Ashton family since 1926.It formerly housed the riding stables for the Grove Hunt.A brick in the walls records the date 1734.The farm now consists of 216 acres on clay soil.It operates mixed farming.Malting barley,feed barley,wheat beans and peas are grown. The owner and one man operate the farm using four tractors,a combine and all modern accessories.Wheat is produced at the inclusive price of Â£110-00 per acre,barley at Â£105 /acre and peas at Â£96 / acre.The farm has four barns.The peas are grown for bread flour under contract to a national bakery.The beans are grown for animal feed.During our visit,greenfly spray was being applied.The fields were divided by hedges. The wheat harvest was expectedduring the middle of August.
